pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:0.5: 64. The training rule on lying down
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people who were lying down. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:1.3.1: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone lying down who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:1.4: One should not give a teaching to anyone lying down who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone who is lying down and who is not sick, even if they are just lying on the ground, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:1.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk64:1.9: The fourth training rule is finished.
